intro: Phacelia piersoniae, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open when mature. Phacelia piersoniae is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
